properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 5 at 4:31PM CST until February 6 at 3:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
......FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH
THURSDAY AFTERNOON...

.A slow moving frontal system will move through the region
through Thursday. Most areas have already experienced 1 to 3
inches of rain with a few areas reporting over 3 inches today.
Additional rounds of thunderstorms with heavy rain and possibly
training storms may produce flash flooding tonight and Thursday.

The Flash Flood Watch continues for

* portions of southeast Mississippi and southern Mississippi,
including the following areas, in southeast Mississippi,
Harrison. In southern Mississippi, Hancock and Jackson.

* through Thursday afternoon

* Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches will be possible
with locally higher amounts.

* Heavy rainfall may lead to flash flooding of poor drainage or
low lying areas.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON
